intro: Dryadella toscanoi, commonly known as the Tuscan dryad, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
